---
title: Overview
description: Understanding the Apsara theming system and ThemeProvider.
---

Apsara provides a flexible theming system that supports light and dark modes, multiple accent colors, gray color variants, and style presets. The `ThemeProvider` component manages theme state and applies the appropriate CSS variables to your application.

## Installation

Wrap your application with the `ThemeProvider` component:

```tsx
import { ThemeProvider } from "@raystack/apsara";

function App() {
  return (
    <ThemeProvider>
      {/* Your application */}
    </ThemeProvider>
  );
}
```

## Theme Modes

Apsara supports three theme modes:

<TokenTable
  tokens={[
    { name: "light", value: "Light mode", description: "Light color scheme" },
    { name: "dark", value: "Dark mode", description: "Dark color scheme" },
    { name: "system", value: "System preference", description: "Follows the user's system preference" },
  ]}
/>

## Style Variants

Style variants affect the overall visual appearance, including border radius and typography:

<TokenTable
  tokens={[
    { name: "modern", value: "Default", description: "Sharp corners, Inter font family" },
    { name: "traditional", value: "Alternative", description: "Softer, rounded corners, Lora/Josefin Sans fonts" },
  ]}
/>

## Accent Colors

Accent colors define the primary brand color used throughout the interface:

<TokenTable
  tokens={[
    { name: "indigo", value: "default", description: "Blue-violet accent" },
    { name: "orange", description: "Warm orange accent" },
    { name: "mint", description: "Fresh mint/teal accent" },
  ]}
/>

## Gray Colors

Gray color variants affect neutral tones throughout the interface:

<TokenTable
  tokens={[
    { name: "gray", value: "default", description: "Pure neutral gray" },
    { name: "mauve", description: "Warm gray with purple undertone" },
    { name: "slate", description: "Cool gray with blue undertone" },
  ]}
/>

## ThemeProvider Props

<auto-type-table path="./props.ts" name="ThemeProviderProps" />

## useTheme Hook

Access and control the current theme using the `useTheme` hook:

```tsx
import { useTheme } from "@raystack/apsara";

function ThemeToggle() {
  const { theme, setTheme, resolvedTheme, systemTheme } = useTheme();

  return (
    <button onClick={() => setTheme(resolvedTheme === "dark" ? "light" : "dark")}>
      Toggle theme
    </button>
  );
}
```

### useTheme Return Values

<auto-type-table path="./props.ts" name="UseThemeProps" />

## Examples

### Basic Setup

```tsx
import { ThemeProvider } from "@raystack/apsara";

function App() {
  return (
    <ThemeProvider defaultTheme="system">
      <YourApp />
    </ThemeProvider>
  );
}
```

### Custom Accent Color

```tsx
<ThemeProvider accentColor="orange" grayColor="slate">
  <YourApp />
</ThemeProvider>
```

### Traditional Style

```tsx
<ThemeProvider style="traditional">
  <YourApp />
</ThemeProvider>
```

### Force Dark Mode

```tsx
<ThemeProvider forcedTheme="dark">
  <YourApp />
</ThemeProvider>
```

### Complete Configuration

```tsx
<ThemeProvider
  defaultTheme="system"
  enableSystem={true}
  style="modern"
  accentColor="indigo"
  grayColor="gray"
  storageKey="my-app-theme"
  disableTransitionOnChange={false}
>
  <YourApp />
</ThemeProvider>
```

## HTML Attributes

The ThemeProvider sets the following attributes on the document element:

<TokenTable
  tokens={[
    { name: "data-theme", value: '"light" | "dark"', description: "Current color scheme" },
    { name: "data-style", value: '"modern" | "traditional"', description: "Visual style variant" },
    { name: "data-accent-color", value: '"indigo"', description: "Accent color" },
    { name: "data-gray-color", value: '"gray"', description: "Gray color variant" },
  ]}
/>

## Avoiding Flash

The ThemeProvider includes an inline script that runs before React hydration to prevent flash of incorrect theme. This ensures the correct theme is applied immediately on page load.

For SSR frameworks, ensure the ThemeProvider is included in your root layout:

```tsx
// Next.js App Router example
// app/layout.tsx
import { ThemeProvider } from "@raystack/apsara";

export default function RootLayout({ children }) {
  return (
    <html lang="en" suppressHydrationWarning>
      <body>
        <ThemeProvider>{children}</ThemeProvider>
      </body>
    </html>
  );
}
```

The `suppressHydrationWarning` is needed because the theme script modifies the HTML element before React hydrates.
